system.description: Savage primitives from backward cultures or untamed worlds; what they lack in knowledge of the stars and the secrets of technology, they more than make up for in strength and survivability.
system.bonusDescription: In the hands of a feral world character, any Low-Tech weapon loses the Primitive quality (if it had it) and gains the Proven (3) quality.

system.description: Skilled with machinery and commonly using the most advanced forms of technology known to the Imperium; surrounded with sanctified technology and often granted cybernetically augmented bodies, they manifest the Omnissiah's blessings.
system.bonusDescription: A forge world character starts with either the Technical Knock or the Weapon-Tech talent.

system.description: The elite who rule over the worlds of the Imperium, obsessed with power and the politics to maintain that power; they may rule from piles of fur on a barren plain, or from the crystalline windows at the top of a hive spire, but all know the precarious nature of power.
system.bonusDescription: Any time a highborn character would reduce his Influence, he reduces it by 1 less (to a minimum reduction of 1).

system.description: The struggling masses of humanity, one among uncounted billions living out their lives in vast towering cities; hardened by living among such dense populations, they are savvy talkers and adept criminals.
system.bonusDescription: A hive world character ignores crowds for purposes of movement, treating them as open terrain. When in enclosed spaces, he also gains a +20 bonus to Navigate (Surface) tests.

system.description: Born in the shadow of great saints, the light of the Emperor blinding and embracing since birth; pious and devout, they see the world through eyes of fanatical faith and righteous hatred.
system.bonusDescription: Whenever a shrine world character spends a Fate point, he rolls 1d10. On a result of 1, the character's total number of Fate points is not reduced.

system.description: Solar nomads and planetary outcasts living out lives in the inky blackness between worlds; touched by celestial winds and their closeness to the Warp, they are often shunned by all but their own kind.
system.bonusDescription: A voidborn character starts with the Strong Minded talent, and gains a +30 bonus to tests for moving in a zero gravity environment.
